item.title: Will Crimson Desert Have Character Creation? All Playable Characters, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Crimson Desert looks fabulous, meaning Crimson Desert character creation tools are a given, a certainty. But you already know it isn’t necessarily the case because you’re here right now, so read on for a full explainer and information on other playable characters.

You only have to look around most outlets in the world to see how much hype and praise there is for Crimson Desert. It has that something extra that other open-world RPGs are missing. From the outside, it seems to have everything, which is where the topic of character creation tools comes in.

It’s been confirmed that Crimson Desert does not have any sort of character creation tools or setup at the start of the game, which means you pretty much need to stick to Kliff’s default appearance.

  • More Insider Gaming: Crimson Desert Sequel or Prequel Status, Explained

You won’t be seeing any humorous Crimson Desert creations online on social media. There won’t be Kliffs with giant heads, wonky noses, or hilariously oversized ears. Pearl Abyss has decided to keep the main character’s features intact, and it does mean you won’t spend your first hour of the game in a menu fiddling with sliding bars, buttons, and other customization features.

However, Crimson Desert doesn’t completely remove all creative liberties and freedom. In-depth looks at the game and interviews show that the RPG has Barbers and other world amenities to slightly tweak the appearance of Kliff and even your horse.

Every Playable Character In Crimson Desert

Crimson Desert has three playable characters throughout your journey: Kliff, Damiane, and Oongka.

Kliff is the starting playable character, and can use all sorts of weapons and skills to inflict damage. He’s the most well-rounded of the three, and probably the one people will gravitate to the most out of familiarity.

  • More Insider Gaming: Crimson Desert’s Premium Price Avoids Microtransactions

Another one of the Greymanes is Damiane, and she is the agile warrior of the trio—expect ranged combat and strategic repositioning to be her forte.

Finally, Oongka is the brute, the powerhouse, the metaphorical bull of the group. You already know how he’s going to play: Big weapons, heavy hits, tank-like movement, and an emphasis on see enemy hurt enemy!

This will be disappointing news to some, but if it’s not the end of the world, then please head to the Insider Gaming Discord to let everyone know what you’re hoping for in Crimson Desert.

Please check out Insider Gaming’s Crimson Desert HANDS-ON PREVIEW to hear our experience with the game.

item.title: Is Crimson Desert A Sequel or Prequel To Black Desert Online?
item.content:encoded:
Crimson Desert is the long-awaited successor to Black Desert Online, and if you played the first one, it’s only natural that you want to know if Crimson Desert is a sequel, a prequel, or something else entirely.

Black Desert Online was an immediate hit, selling several hundred thousand copies. Now, in 2026, millions of players have registered, and the MMO has grossed billions. There’s a lot of love for Black Desert Online, which is why its direct connections to Crimson Desert are fascinating for both old and new players.

Is Crimson Desert A Prequel To Black Desert Online?

No, despite being initially conceived as a prequel to Black Desert Online, Crimson Desert has dropped any notion of this idea.

There’s your first big question about this story answered: Crimson Desert is not a prequel. Pearl Abyss has mentioned in interviews that the goal was to have Crimson Desert be another MMO, serving as a precursor to Black Desert Online.

  • More Insider Gaming: Crimson Desert Devs Say Premium Price Avoids Microtransactions

Abyss’ vision and scope for the project quickly expanded, which is why Crimson Desert is not a prequel.

Is Crimson Desert A Sequel To Black Desert Online?

Crimson Desert is also not a direct sequel to Black Desert Online, and it’s closer to a spiritual successor than having any direct ties to the original game.

There are many key differences between Crimson Desert and Black Desert Online—including its single-player and multiplayer focus—but the world itself is another big one.

  • More Insider Gaming: Crimson Desert HANDS-ON PREVIEW

Crimson Desert is set in Pywel, whereas Black Desert Online was separated into several key and distinct regions. Aside from the setting being new, there are also new characters and a fresh narrative—underlining that while the game remains grounded in the same universe, this is a whole new game, and isn’t a sequel or prequel!

The main positive about this creative decision is that if you haven’t played Black Desert Online, you won’t need to play catch-up and can jump right in.

But if you have played Black Desert Online at any point, share your thoughts on the game and what you’re hoping for in Crimson Desert. You can do so via the usual place: The Insider Gaming Discord.

If you’re worried about delays or anything similar, you should be reassured by the news that Crimson Desert went Gold two months before release.

item.title: Today’s Strands #725 Hints and Answers for February 26, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #725 for Thursday, February 26, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website or on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 26, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #725 are all related to being “rude.” In this case, “rude” is less gross or mean-spirited and more argumentative and combative.

General Strands Hints For February 26

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: Laundry out the dryer always smells so ____ and clean. Also, think OutKast.
  • Hint 2: One of the original shows on PTV in Family Guy featured Stewie and Brian. The premise was that Stewie was a “____ bastard.”
  • Hint 3: Puppies’ best quality.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #725 for February 26, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 26, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • CURE
  • DENT
  • PETAL
  • TALK
  • SENT

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #725 On February 26, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below. Check out the answers for yesterday’s puzzle here.

  • PERT
  • CUTE
  • FRESH
  • IMPUDENT
  • SASSY
  • SAUCY
  • CHEEKY
  • SPANAGRAM: TALKINGBACK

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #725?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 27 will be Strands Game #726.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.
